meanings.definition: The state of becoming hot or heated.
meanings.sent1: After playing outside in the sun all day, the children felt the incalescences of their skin.
meanings.sent2: The incalescences of the oven made the kitchen unbearably warm.
meanings.sent3: The incalescences of the spicy chili made everyone reach for a glass of water.
meanings.sent4: As the argument escalated, the incalescences of anger filled the room.
meanings.sent5: The incalescences of the bonfire illuminated the night sky.

meanings.definition: The process of heating up or becoming hot.
meanings.sent1: The incalescences of the metal rod were visible as it turned red.
meanings.sent2: During summer, the incalescences of the pavement could burn your feet.
meanings.sent3: The incalescences of the race made the audience cheer louder.
meanings.sent4: The incalescences of excitement spread through the crowd as the concert began.
meanings.sent5: The incalescences of the engine signaled a problem that needed fixing.
